notes.conversion: SNES uses 8.8 fixed-point format. Values like $0140 = 320 decimal = 1.25 in fixed-point (320/256). Converting to pixels/second at 60Hz, then scaling to 120Hz.
notes.confidence: Medium - values extracted from sprite initialization and movement code. Some values inferred from common DKC2 behavior.

walkSpeed.notes: Max walk speed in pixels/second (converted from $0140 = 320 subpixels/frame at 60Hz)

runSpeed.notes: Max run speed in pixels/second (converted from $0180 = 384 subpixels/frame at 60Hz)

acceleration.notes: Ground acceleration in pixels/second^2 (estimated from movement feel)

deceleration.notes: Ground deceleration when not pressing direction (estimated)

initialVelocity.notes: Initial jump velocity in pixels/second (negative = up). Converted from typical jump y_speed values.

variableJumpCutVelocity.notes: Velocity when jump button released early (half of initial)

coyoteTime.notes: Coyote time in seconds (6 frames at 60Hz, 12 frames at 120Hz)

jumpBuffer.notes: Jump buffer window in seconds (9 frames at 60Hz, 18 frames at 120Hz)

gravity.notes: Gravity acceleration in pixels/second^2 (estimated from fall speed)

clampVelocity.notes: Maximum fall speed while gliding in pixels/second

slideThreshold.notes: Slopes steeper than this trigger sliding

autoSlideThreshold.notes: Slopes steeper than this auto-slide even without down input

slideAcceleration.notes: Acceleration along slope tangent when sliding

followSnapDistance.notes: Distance threshold for snapping thrower to landing point
